description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award On August 12-21, 2015, APHIS conducted a geographic information systems (GIS) course aimed at spatial analysis of statistical information related to animal health for decision-making. The training included presentations, group discussions, field practice, and a table top exercise. Instructors provided technical support to South American countries providing tools to enhance their animal programs. The course covered the introduction to the description of spatial visualization principles of Animal Health data, practical knowledge to field technicians for the configuration, handling of GPS receivers, collection of data and preparation of basic maps, and assessing the appropriate tools and techniques for the study of disease risk factors with spatial and temporal clustering in animal health (FAD).
